fields.title: Change HVAC Filter
fields.description: Replace your HVAC air filter to maintain efficiency and air quality.
fields.tools_required: New filter (check size), Screwdriver (sometimes)
fields.step_by_step:
1. Turn off HVAC system
2. Locate the air filter (usually near the return air duct or furnace)
3. Note the size printed on the old filter
4. Remove the old filter
5. Insert new filter (check arrow direction for airflow)
6. Turn system back on
7. Mark your calendar for next month
fields.safety_notes: Turn off the system before replacing the filter.

fields.title: Clean Gutters
fields.description: Remove leaves and debris from gutters to prevent water damage.
fields.tools_required: Ladder, Work gloves, Garden hose, Bucket or tarp, Safety goggles
fields.step_by_step:
1. Set up ladder safely on level ground
2. Wear gloves and safety goggles
3. Scoop out leaves and debris by hand
4. Place debris in bucket or drop onto tarp below
5. Flush gutters with garden hose
6. Check downspouts are clear
7. Inspect for damage or leaks
fields.safety_notes: Use a sturdy ladder and have someone spot you. Never lean too far to the side.

fields.title: Test Smoke and Carbon Monoxide Detectors
fields.description: Ensure all safety detectors are functioning properly.
fields.tools_required: Step stool or ladder, Replacement batteries (if needed)
fields.step_by_step:
1. Press the test button on each detector
2. Listen for the alarm sound
3. Replace batteries if needed (usually 9V)
4. Replace any detectors older than 10 years
5. Keep a log of test dates
fields.safety_notes: Never disable a detector. Replace batteries immediately if low.

fields.title: Inspect and Clean Dryer Vent
fields.description: Prevent fire hazards by keeping dryer vents clean.
fields.tools_required: Dryer vent brush or vacuum attachment, Screwdriver
fields.step_by_step:
1. Unplug the dryer
2. Pull dryer away from wall
3. Disconnect vent hose from dryer
4. Use brush or vacuum to clean lint from hose
5. Clean exterior vent opening
6. Reconnect and test
fields.safety_notes: Lint buildup is a fire hazard. Do not operate dryer with damaged vent.

fields.title: Test Garage Door Safety Features
fields.description: Ensure garage door auto-reverse is functioning to prevent injuries.
fields.tools_required: 2x4 board or similar object
fields.step_by_step:
1. Open garage door fully
2. Place board flat on ground in door's path
3. Press button to close door
4. Door should reverse when it contacts board
5. If it doesn't reverse, adjust sensitivity or call professional
fields.safety_notes: Never place yourself under a moving garage door during testing.

fields.title: Flush Water Heater
fields.description: Remove sediment buildup to extend water heater life and efficiency.
fields.tools_required: Garden hose, Bucket, Work gloves
fields.step_by_step:
1. Turn off power/gas to water heater
2. Turn off cold water supply
3. Let water cool for several hours
4. Connect hose to drain valve
5. Open drain valve and pressure relief valve
6. Drain until water runs clear
7. Close valves and refill tank
8. Turn power back on
fields.safety_notes: Water will be hot. Allow adequate cooling time. Turn off power before draining.

fields.title: Inspect Roof for Damage
fields.description: Check for missing shingles, leaks, or damage from weather.
fields.tools_required: Binoculars (for ground inspection), Ladder, Camera
fields.step_by_step:
1. Inspect from ground with binoculars first
2. Look for missing, cracked, or curled shingles
3. Check flashing around chimneys and vents
4. Inspect attic for water stains or daylight
5. Take photos of any damage
6. Call professional if repairs needed
fields.safety_notes: Roof work is dangerous. Consider hiring a professional for close inspection.

fields.title: Seal Windows and Doors
fields.description: Improve energy efficiency by sealing air leaks.
fields.tools_required: Caulk gun, Weatherstripping, Foam sealant
fields.step_by_step:
1. Inspect all windows and doors for drafts
2. Clean surfaces to be sealed
3. Apply new caulk to gaps around window frames
4. Install or replace weatherstripping on doors
5. Use foam sealant for larger gaps
6. Check for improvement with candle/incense smoke test
fields.safety_notes: Work in well-ventilated area when using sealants.

fields.title: Clean Range Hood Filter
fields.description: Remove grease buildup for better ventilation and fire safety.
fields.tools_required: Dish soap, Degreaser, Hot water, Scrub brush
fields.step_by_step:
1. Remove filter from range hood
2. Soak in hot soapy water for 10 minutes
3. Apply degreaser if needed
4. Scrub with brush
5. Rinse thoroughly
6. Dry completely before reinstalling
fields.safety_notes: Ensure filter is completely dry before reinstalling to prevent electrical issues.

fields.title: Test Sump Pump
fields.description: Ensure sump pump is working to prevent basement flooding.
fields.tools_required: Bucket of water
fields.step_by_step:
1. Locate sump pump in basement
2. Pour bucket of water into sump pit
3. Watch for pump to activate automatically
4. Verify water is pumped out
5. Listen for unusual noises
6. Check outlet pipe for blockages
fields.safety_notes: Never touch pump while it is running. Keep area around pump clear.

fields.title: Winterize Outdoor Faucets
fields.description: Prevent frozen pipe damage by winterizing outdoor faucets.
fields.tools_required: Faucet covers, Wrench
fields.step_by_step:
1. Shut off water supply to outdoor faucets
2. Open outdoor faucets to drain remaining water
3. Leave faucets open during winter
4. Install insulated faucet covers
5. Drain and store garden hoses
6. Consider installing frost-free faucets
fields.safety_notes: Complete before first hard freeze to prevent pipe bursts.

fields.title: Clean Refrigerator Coils
fields.description: Improve efficiency and extend appliance life by cleaning coils.
fields.tools_required: Vacuum with brush attachment, Coil brush, Screwdriver
fields.step_by_step:
1. Unplug refrigerator
2. Pull refrigerator away from wall (if needed)
3. Locate coils (back or bottom)
4. Remove any cover panel
5. Vacuum dust and debris from coils
6. Use coil brush for stubborn buildup
7. Replace panel and plug back in
fields.safety_notes: Always unplug before cleaning. Be gentle with coils to avoid damage.

fields.title: Roof and Flashing Inspection
fields.description: Check shingles for damage or loss. Inspect all roof penetrations (vents, chimneys, pipes) and metal flashing for signs of leaks. Look for missing granules, curling edges, or exposed underlayment.
fields.tools_required: Binoculars, Ladder, Safety harness, Flashlight

fields.title: Gutter and Downspout Cleaning
fields.description: Clean gutters in fall and spring to prevent clogs. Remove leaves, debris, and buildup. Ensure proper drainage away from foundation. Check for loose brackets and repair as needed.
fields.tools_required: Ladder, Garden hose, Gutter scoop, Work gloves, Safety goggles

fields.title: Foundation and Drainage Check
fields.description: Inspect foundation for cracks, settling, or water intrusion. Ensure ground slopes away from house (minimum 6 inches drop over 10 feet). Check basement for moisture or mold.
fields.tools_required: Flashlight, Level, Tape measure

fields.title: Window and Door Weatherstripping
fields.description: Replace worn weatherstripping around windows and doors. Refresh exterior caulk to maintain thermal envelope and prevent air leaks. Check for drafts on windy days.
fields.tools_required: Caulk gun, Weatherstripping, Utility knife, Scraper

fields.title: Fire Extinguisher Check
fields.description: Verify all fire extinguishers show pressure gauge in green zone. Check for damage, corrosion, or obstruction. Ensure they are easily accessible and properly mounted.
fields.tools_required: None

fields.title: Siding and Trim Inspection
fields.description: Check exterior siding (wood, vinyl, brick, stucco) for damage, rot, or peeling paint. Repair to prevent structural water damage. Look for pest intrusion points.
fields.tools_required: Ladder, Flashlight, Screwdriver, Moisture meter

fields.title: Garage Door Maintenance
fields.description: Lubricate hinges, rollers, and tracks with silicone spray. Check tension and balance of torsion springs. Test auto-reverse safety feature. Tighten all hardware.
fields.tools_required: Silicone spray, Socket wrench, Level

fields.title: Radon Testing
fields.description: Perform radon test using short-term or long-term kit, especially in basement areas. Mitigate if levels exceed 4 pCi/L. Retest every 2 years or after major renovations.
fields.tools_required: Radon test kit

fields.title: HVAC Filter Replacement
fields.description: Replace or clean HVAC air filters every 1-3 months depending on usage and filter type. Maintains system efficiency and indoor air quality. Check filter size and MERV rating.
fields.tools_required: Replacement filter (correct size), Vacuum (for reusable filters)

fields.title: HVAC Professional Service
fields.description: Schedule annual HVAC tune-up. Technician checks refrigerant, coils, blower, electrical connections, thermostat calibration, and combustion safety for furnaces.
fields.tools_required: Professional HVAC technician

fields.title: Water Heater Flush
fields.description: Drain several gallons from water heater to remove sediment buildup. Improves efficiency and extends lifespan. Check anode rod condition and pressure relief valve operation.
fields.tools_required: Garden hose, Bucket, Screwdriver

fields.title: Leak and Fixture Check
fields.description: Check all faucets, toilets, and visible pipes for leaks. Test shut-off valves. Inspect under sinks and around water heater. Early detection prevents water damage.
fields.tools_required: Flashlight, Paper towels, Wrench

fields.title: Septic System Pumping
fields.description: Pump septic tank every 3-5 years depending on household size and usage. Schedule professional inspection to check baffles, distribution box, and drain field condition.
fields.tools_required: Professional septic service

fields.title: Electrical Panel Inspection
fields.description: Check electrical panel for signs of corrosion, burning smells, warm breakers, or buzzing sounds. Test GFCI and AFCI breakers monthly. Consider professional inspection for older panels.
fields.tools_required: Flashlight, GFCI tester, Infrared thermometer

fields.title: Sump Pump Test
fields.description: Pour water into sump pit to verify pump activates properly. Check discharge line for blockages. Test battery backup system if equipped. Critical before spring thaw and heavy rain seasons.
fields.tools_required: Bucket of water, Flashlight

fields.title: Appliance Coil Cleaning
fields.description: Vacuum refrigerator and freezer condenser coils to improve efficiency. Clean dryer vent hose and exterior vent to prevent fire hazards. Check gaskets and door seals.
fields.tools_required: Vacuum with hose attachment, Dryer vent brush, Coil cleaning brush

fields.title: Solar Panel Cleaning
fields.description: Clean solar panels to remove dust, pollen, bird droppings, and debris that reduce efficiency. Use soft brush and soapy water. Inspect for cracks or damage to glass and frames.
fields.tools_required: Soft brush, Squeegee, Garden hose, Safety harness

fields.title: Solar Inverter and Charge Controller Check
fields.description: Monitor inverter and charge controller for error codes or unusual behavior. Check voltage readings and ensure proper battery charging. Clean cooling vents to prevent overheating.
fields.tools_required: Multimeter, Cleaning cloth, Flashlight

fields.title: Battery Bank Maintenance
fields.description: For lead-acid batteries: Check electrolyte levels and add distilled water if needed. Clean terminals and check connections. Monitor voltage and specific gravity readings. Lithium batteries require less maintenance.
fields.tools_required: Distilled water, Hydrometer, Wire brush, Baking soda solution, Safety goggles

fields.title: Generator Exercise and Service
fields.description: Run generator under load for 30 minutes monthly to prevent fuel system issues. Check oil level, coolant, and battery. Annual service includes oil change, filter replacement, and spark plug inspection.
fields.tools_required: Oil, Oil filter, Fuel stabilizer, Wrench set, Funnel

fields.title: Well Water Testing
fields.description: Test well water annually for bacteria, nitrates, and pH. Test every 3-5 years for heavy metals and other contaminants. More frequent testing after flooding, nearby land use changes, or taste/odor issues.
fields.tools_required: Water testing kit or professional lab service

fields.title: Cistern and Rainwater Storage Cleaning
fields.description: Drain and clean rainwater storage tanks to remove sediment and algae. Inspect gutters and first-flush diverters. Check pumps and filtration systems. Sanitize before refilling.
fields.tools_required: Pump, Scrub brush, Bleach solution, Hose, PPE

fields.title: Wood Stove and Chimney Sweep
fields.description: Hire certified chimney sweep to remove creosote buildup and prevent chimney fires. Inspect stove gaskets, firebrick, and catalytic combustor. Check chimney cap and flashing for damage.
fields.tools_required: Professional chimney sweep

fields.title: Composting Toilet Maintenance
fields.description: Add bulking agent (sawdust, peat moss) as needed. Check moisture levels and ventilation fan operation. Empty finished compost according to system guidelines. Inspect seals and hinges.
fields.tools_required: Bulking material, Compost thermometer, Gloves

fields.title: Tractor Oil and Filter Change
fields.description: Change engine oil and filter annually or per manufacturer hours recommendation. Use correct viscosity oil for climate. Check hydraulic fluid, transmission fluid, and coolant levels during service.
fields.tools_required: Oil, Oil filter, Drain pan, Wrenches, Funnel, Shop rags

fields.title: Grease Fittings Service
fields.description: Apply grease to all zerk fittings on tractor, loader, backhoe, and implements. Prevents wear on pivot points, PTO shafts, and moving parts. Consult equipment manual for fitting locations.
fields.tools_required: Grease gun, Multipurpose grease

fields.title: Tire Pressure and Condition Check
fields.description: Check tire pressure on tractors, trucks, trailers, and implements. Inspect for cuts, bulges, or excessive wear. Proper inflation improves fuel economy and prevents premature tire failure.
fields.tools_required: Tire pressure gauge, Air compressor

fields.title: Air Filter Inspection
fields.description: Check and clean or replace air filters on tractors, mowers, chainsaws, and other gas-powered equipment. Dusty conditions require more frequent changes. Improves performance and engine life.
fields.tools_required: Replacement air filters, Compressed air

fields.title: Mower Blade Sharpening
fields.description: Sharpen mower blades before and mid-season. Sharp blades cut cleanly and promote healthy grass. Check blade balance and mounting bolts. Replace if bent or excessively worn.
fields.tools_required: Angle grinder or file, Blade balancer, Socket set, Work gloves

fields.title: Implement and Attachment Cleaning
fields.description: Clean soil, crop residue, and debris from plows, discs, seeders, and other implements after use. Prevents rust and ensures proper function. Inspect for wear or damage before storage.
fields.tools_required: Pressure washer or hose, Scraper, Wire brush

fields.title: Fuel Stabilization and Tank Care
fields.description: Add fuel stabilizer to gas-powered equipment before long-term storage (winter for mowers, summer for snow blowers). Keep fuel tanks full to prevent condensation. Drain carburetors if storing.
fields.tools_required: Fuel stabilizer, Funnel, Container for drained fuel

fields.title: Battery Maintenance and Storage
fields.description: Remove batteries from seasonal equipment and store in temperature-controlled area. Clean terminals and apply corrosion preventer. Maintain charge with battery tender. Test before reinstalling.
fields.tools_required: Battery terminal cleaner, Baking soda solution, Battery tender, Wrench

fields.title: Belt and Hose Inspection
fields.description: Inspect drive belts for cracks, glazing, or fraying. Check coolant and fuel hoses for leaks, brittleness, or swelling. Replace before failure to avoid breakdowns during critical work periods.
fields.tools_required: Flashlight, Replacement belts and hoses

fields.title: Fence Line Patrol and Repair
fields.description: Walk fence perimeter to check for damage, loose posts, broken wires, or rot. Repair immediately to contain livestock and mark property boundaries. Clear vegetation touching fence.
fields.tools_required: Fence tester, Wire cutters, Come-along, Post driver, Staples

fields.title: Barn and Outbuilding Inspection
fields.description: Inspect barns, sheds, and outbuildings for roof leaks, structural damage, and pest intrusion. Check doors, windows, and ventilation. Repair before winter weather or equipment storage season.
fields.tools_required: Ladder, Flashlight, Hammer, Nails, Caulk

fields.title: Pasture Rotation and Rest
fields.description: Rotate livestock through pastures to prevent overgrazing. Allow pastures to rest and regrow before returning animals. Monitor for bare spots, weed pressure, and soil compaction.
fields.tools_required: Fencing supplies for temporary paddocks

fields.title: Rodent and Pest Proofing
fields.description: Seal gaps and holes in outbuildings before winter. Store feed in rodent-proof containers. Set traps in barns and sheds. Check for signs of mice, rats, raccoons, or other pests regularly.
fields.tools_required: Steel wool, Expanding foam, Hardware cloth, Traps

fields.title: Driveway and Access Road Grading
fields.description: Grade gravel driveways and access roads to maintain crown and drainage. Fill potholes and ruts. Add gravel as needed. Improves access in wet weather and reduces erosion.
fields.tools_required: Tractor with box blade, Gravel, Rake

fields.title: Soil Testing
fields.description: Test soil pH and nutrient levels annually in vegetable garden and orchard. Send samples to extension office or use home test kit. Amend soil based on results for optimal plant growth.
fields.tools_required: Soil test kit or extension office service, Trowel, Sample bags

fields.title: Perennial Bed Maintenance
fields.description: Divide overcrowded perennials in spring or fall. Mulch beds to suppress weeds and retain moisture. Cut back dead foliage. Refresh mulch annually to maintain 2-3 inch depth.
fields.tools_required: Spade, Pruners, Mulch, Garden fork, Wheelbarrow

fields.title: Garden Tool Cleaning and Sharpening
fields.description: Clean soil and sap from tools after each season. Sharpen shovels, hoes, and pruners. Oil wooden handles and metal parts. Store in dry location to prevent rust.
fields.tools_required: Wire brush, File or sharpening stone, Linseed oil, WD-40

fields.title: Fruit Tree Pruning
fields.description: Prune fruit trees in late winter while dormant. Remove dead, diseased, or crossing branches. Thin center to improve air circulation and sunlight penetration. Shape young trees for structure.
fields.tools_required: Pruning saw, Loppers, Hand pruners, Ladder, Safety glasses

fields.title: Compost Pile Turning
fields.description: Turn compost pile monthly to aerate and speed decomposition. Maintain proper moisture (like wrung-out sponge). Balance green (nitrogen) and brown (carbon) materials. Monitor temperature.
fields.tools_required: Pitchfork, Garden hose, Compost thermometer

fields.title: Cover Crop Planting
fields.description: Plant cover crops (clover, rye, vetch) in fall to prevent erosion, fix nitrogen, and improve soil structure. Terminate in spring before planting. Builds organic matter over time.
fields.tools_required: Cover crop seed, Broadcast spreader or drill, Rake

fields.title: Irrigation System Winterization
fields.description: Blow out irrigation lines with compressed air before first freeze. Drain pumps and above-ground piping. Insulate backflow preventers. Prevents costly freeze damage to irrigation systems.
fields.tools_required: Air compressor, Wrenches, Insulation wrap

fields.title: Cold Frame and Greenhouse Repair
fields.description: Inspect cold frames and greenhouses for broken glass, torn plastic, or damaged frames. Repair before winter to extend growing season. Check vents, hinges, and automatic openers.
fields.tools_required: Replacement glazing, Screws, Caulk, Silicone sealant

fields.title: Seed Inventory and Storage
fields.description: Inventory leftover seeds and organize by type and year. Store in cool, dry, dark location. Test germination rates of older seeds. Plan seed orders for next season based on garden plan.
fields.tools_required: Airtight containers, Labels, Silica gel packets

fields.title: Mulch Application
fields.description: Apply 2-3 inches of mulch around trees, shrubs, and garden beds. Use wood chips, straw, or compost. Mulch conserves moisture, moderates soil temperature, and suppresses weeds.
fields.tools_required: Mulch (wood chips, straw, compost), Wheelbarrow, Rake, Shovel

fields.title: Raised Bed Soil Refresh
fields.description: Add compost and organic matter to raised beds each spring. Soil level drops as organic material decomposes. Top-dress with 2-4 inches of finished compost to replenish nutrients.
fields.tools_required: Compost, Shovel, Rake, Wheelbarrow

fields.title: Green Waste Management
fields.description: Chip brush and branches for mulch. Compost garden waste and kitchen scraps. Burn diseased material or dispose properly. Maintain clear paths and work areas. Reduces fire hazard on rural properties.
fields.tools_required: Chipper, Pruning saw, Wheelbarrow, Burn barrel (where permitted)
